newsitem.title: USA: Electrochemical first half loss narrows.
newsitem.headline: Electrochemical first half loss narrows.

text.p: Electrochemical Industries Ltd said Monday it sharply reduced its losses from consolidated results for the 1997 first half compared with a year earlier.
The Israeli company said it had a net loss in the first six months of 1997 of US$1.2 million on sales of US$64.8 million.
Financing expenses were US$1.2 million, and gross profit was US$6.0 million, it said.
The company did not provide year-earlier numbers in U.S. dollars.
However, in New Israeli Shekels (NIS), it reported a first half net loss of 4.4 million, down from a year-ago net loss of 17.3 million.
Sales rose to 232.4 million NIS from 217.0 million, financing expenses fell to 4.2 million NIS from 5.8 million, and gross profits advanced to 21.4 million NIS from 16.6 million, it said.
The company said its efficiency program, begun in the second half of 1996, helped its results.
It also said production levels at its PVC plants were high compared to the same period in 1996, mainly due to the completion of an expansion of the main plant.
